!Bubble Eye Goldfish
|- align=left
|
|- align=center bgcolor=pink
!Country of origin
|- align=center
|China
|- align=center bgcolor=pink
!Type
|- align=center
|Bubble eye
|- align=center bgcolor=pink
!Species
|- align=center
|Carassius auratus auratus
|- align=center bgcolor=pink
!Breed standards
|- align=center [http://www.bristol-
|  aquarists.org.uk/goldfish/bubble/bubble.htm BAS]
|- align=center bgcolor=pink }

The 'Bubble Eye' is a small variety of fancy goldfish with upward pointing eyes
that are accompanied by two large fluid-filled sacs. It is a dorsal-less fish,
and good specimens will have a clean back and eye bubbles well matched for
colour and size. The bubbles are fragile and the fish should be kept separately
from boisterous types and away from sharp tank decor, although the bubbles will
regrow if punctured. and they become very tame. "Fancy
Goldfish: A Complete Guide to Care and Collecting" by Dr. Erik L. Johnson,
D.V.M. and Richard E. Hess, Weatherhill, Shambala Publications, Inc., 2006 -
ISBN 0-8348-0448-4 It is known as 'suihogan' in
Japan. [http://www.hagen.com/usa/aquatic/more.cfm Nutrafin Aquatic News:
Goldfishes, Issue #4, 2004, Rolf C. Hagen (U.S.A,) Inc. and Rolf C. Hagen
Corp.(Montreal, Canada)]
